Dyeing of wool at low
temperatures

byline.docAuthor:
Kononenko, V.P., Makarovskaya, N.I., Kharkharov,
A.A., Kaltakhchyan, E.G., Markaryan, A.N.

front.div:
Abstract
The use of polyethyleneimine resin as a
dyeing accelerant in the low-temperature
dyeing of wool with acid and reactive dyes
in fibre and sliver form is investigated. This
enables wool to be dyed in bright saturated
shades at 80 degrees C. Dyeing time can
be reduced, power consumption is
decreased, and crockfastness and end-use
properties are improved.
